body.p: A Kentucky attorney, educator, and politician. Educated in Manchester, Ohio. Taught two terms of Lewis County in 1849 and 1850. Studied law and admitted to the bar in 1851. Practiced law in Flemingsburg, Kentucky. Married to Elizabeth “Lizzie” Barbour Helm Bruce. Father of Lucinda Hardin Bruce, John Helm Bruce, Elizabeth “Lizzie” Barbour Bruce, Barbour Bruce, Preston Pope Bruce, Mary P. Bruce Smith, and Alexander Bruce. Owned five enslaved persons in 1860. Member of the Whig Party, American “Know-Nothing” Party, and Southern Rights Party. Elected and served as an American “Know-Nothing” Party member of the Kentucky House of Representatives in 1855. Elected as the Commonwealth’s attorney for the Tenth District in 1856. Removed to Louisville, Kentucky in 1858. Representative at the Russellville Convention that established the Provisional Government of Kentucky. Served as a member of the Council of Ten in the Provisional Government of Kentucky. Served the Seventh Congressional District as a member of the First and Second Confederate Congress in the House of Representatives from 1862 to 1865.
